ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You don't learn as much as the first semester. Your experience very much depends on your Marshall Group and your topic. My topic was one of the bigger issues of the day, and thus proved exciting throughout. However, I know people in other groups had less positive experiences.

Second semester of GS is much stronger than the first. Working in teams is a rare opportunity in a Yale class, and GS does it really well. I learned a TON from my marshall brief preparation, and by the end I felt like I actually really had a handle on the issue. I also bonded a lot with the other members of my team, who were awesome. It's funny, you come into GS thinking that all the other kids are d-bags, but by the end of the year you have real affection for them. I felt this especially during the simulation, which was actually a lot of fun, and again, a unique experience at Yale and beyond.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It didn't, but I didn't think it would.
